page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This is a gentle undulating{rural area straddled between Sway and the outskirts of Hordle to the West and Boldre and Lymington to the East. It consists mainly of{farmland}for cattle grazing , private housing, nuseries and some light engineering, with a stretch of the New Forest itself to the North. The impression is of a rich fertile land with leafy lanes, reasonably traffic free until you meet the busy A337. { Housing}is generally scattered with an assortment of large houses, cottages and bungalows, many tucked away at the end of long drives. It is a broad area between villages with no local shopping facilities and little evidence of public transport.
